summary.span: Represents the for collections that implement , such as Microsoft ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) data views.

span.span: Represents the for collections that implement , such as Microsoft ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) data views.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 所有集合都有默认。All collections have a default . 实现的集合或，默认集合视图是。For collections that implement or , the default collection view is . 具体而言，需要，和是可选的接口，使其他排序和筛选支持。Specifically, is required for , and is an optional interface that gives additional sorting and filtering support. 如果你有多个对象，并且基础源是`DataTable`或`DataView`，视图对象不排序或筛选独立。If you have multiple objects and the underlying source is a `DataTable` or a `DataView`, the view objects do not sort or filter independently. 例如，如果你有两个对象具有相同关联`DataTable`并执行排序视图之一，在其他视图中的项的顺序可能会受到影响。For example, if you have two objects associated with the same `DataTable` and you perform sorting on one of the views, the order of items in the other view can be affected. 这是因为对象使用基础用于排序和筛选功能。This is because objects use the underlying for sorting and filtering functionalities. 有关集合视图的详细信息，请参阅[数据绑定概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md)。For more information about collection views, see [Data Binding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md).

summary.span: Starts an add transaction and returns the pending new item.

span.span: Starts an add transaction and returns the pending new item.
The pending new item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用开始添加事务。Calling begins an add transaction. 应调用或来结束添加事务。You should call or to end the add transaction. 始终在集合视图中将出现一个新项。A new item always appears in the collection view. 任何筛选、 排序或分组操作也将应用于该视图应用到新项时调用。Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the view is applied to the new item when is called.

span.span: Gets a value that indicates whether a new item can be added to the collection.

value.span: 如果可以将新项添加到集合中，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if a new item can be added to the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以创建集合的新项，如果存在不是编辑事务发生，如果该集合不为固定的大小，并且如果该集合不为只读的。The can create a new item for the collection if there is not an edit transaction occurring, if the collection is not a fixed size, and if the collection is not read-only.

span.span: if the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是`true`如果编辑的项实现接口。 is `true` if the edited item implements the interface. 如果是`false`，调用以使视图退出编辑状态，并提供逻辑，以还原在编辑过的对象上的更改。If is `false`, call to cause the view to exit the edit state and provide logic to revert the changes on the object that was edited.

summary.span: Ends the edit transaction and, if possible, restores the original value to the item.

span.span: Ends the edit transaction and, if possible, restores the original value to the item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 设置到`null`，并使集合视图退出编辑状态。 sets to `null` and causes the collection view to exit the edit state. 如果是`true`，还将还原所编辑对象的原始值。If is `true`, also restores the original values of the edited object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法不会不进行任何假设项是否属于基础集合。This method does not make any assumptions about whether the item belongs to the underlying collection. 如果你知道该项属于基础集合，它会更加高效调用。If you know that the item belongs to the underlying collection, it is more efficient to call .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: virtual property int Count { int get(); };

summary.span: Gets the estimated number of records in the collection.

span.span: Gets the estimated number of records in the collection.

value.span:
以下项之一： 值含义
-1 无法确定集合的计数。这可能是由"虚拟化"视图返回，其中视图特意不考虑基础集合中的所有项，因为该视图尝试提高效率和最小化依赖于始终整个集合都可用。
任何其他整数集合的计数。

span.span:
One of the following: Value Meaning
-1 Could not determine the count of the collection. This might be returned by a "virtualizing" view, where the view deliberately does not account for all items in the underlying collection because the view is attempting to increase efficiency and minimize dependence on always having the entire collection available.
any other integer The count of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请注意，此计数表示已筛选的计数。Note that this count represents the filtered count.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性来测试是否视图支持之前将字符串分配给此属性的自定义筛选。Use the property to test whether the view supports custom filtering before assigning a string to this property. 语法取决于实现。The syntax depends on the implementation. 有关受支持的筛选器表达式语法的示例，请参阅。For an example of the supported filter expression syntax, see . 请注意，如果你有多个对象，并且基础源是`DataTable`或`DataView`，视图对象不排序或筛选独立。Note that if you have multiple objects and the underlying source is a `DataTable` or a `DataView`, the view objects do not sort or filter independently. 例如，如果你有两个对象具有相同关联`DataTable`并执行排序视图之一，在其他视图中的项的顺序可能会受到影响。For example, if you have two objects associated with the same `DataTable` and you perform sorting on one of the views, the order of items in the other view can be affected. 这是因为对象使用基础用于排序和筛选功能。This is because objects use the underlying for sorting and filtering functionalities.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 仅可以通过访问的集合对象并使用它的各种方法，例如添加设置此属性。This property can only be set by accessing the collection object and using its various methods such as Add. 要访问集合对象本身的属性是只读的;集合本身是可读/写。The property to access the collection object itself is read-only; the collection itself is read/write. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此属性：The following example shows how to use this property: [!code-csharp[DataBindingLab#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DataBindingLab/CSharp/MainWindow.xaml.cs#6)] [!code-vb[DataBindingLab#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DataBindingLab/VisualBasic/MainWindow.xaml.vb#6)] 有关完整示例，请参阅[数据绑定演示](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=163703)。For the complete example, see [Data Binding Demo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=163703).

summary.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the list of items (after applying the sort and filters, if any) is already in the correct order for grouping.

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the list of items (after applying the sort and filters, if any) is already in the correct order for grouping.

value.span: 如果项列表已在正确的顺序分组，则为否则为。

span.span: if the list of items is already in the correct order for grouping; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性设置为`true`会通知视图的项的列表，已在进行分组的正确顺序，并允许视图以使用更有效的算法来生成组。Setting this property to `true` informs the view that the list of items is already in the correct order for grouping and allows the view to use a more efficient algorithm to build the groups. 该数据会在正确的顺序如果：The data is in the correct order if: 1. 属于给定组的所有项都显示连续，和All items belonging to a given group appear consecutively, and 2. 如果集合为非空中的组显示之前的任何其他组，和中的相同顺序。If the collection is non-empty, the groups in appear before any other groups, and in the same order as in .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 与不同方法，此方法假定指定的项属于基础集合。Unlike the method, this method assumes that the specified item belongs to the underlying collection. 此方法将筛选器考虑在内。This method takes filters into account. 通常情况下，你使用此方法在集合更改通知过程来确定是否添加或移除的项需要处理。Typically, you use this method during collection-changed notifications to determine if the added or removed item requires processing.

summary.span: Removes the item at the specified position from the collection.

span.span: Removes the item at the specified position from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `index` 是集合视图，而不是集合相对路径。`index` is relative to the collection view, not the collection. 例如，如果集合具有 10 项，并且视图具有以便 7 项将出现，有效的值的`index`为 0 到 6。For example, if the collection has 10 items and the view has a so that 7 items appear, the valid values of `index` are 0 through 6.

exception.span: is less than 0 or greater than the number of items in the collection view.

span.span: is less than 0 or greater than the number of items in the collection view.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property SortDescriptions As SortDescriptionCollection

summary.span: Gets a collection of objects that describes how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.

span.span: Gets a collection of objects that describes how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.

value.span: 集合这些对象描述集合中的项在视图中的排序方式。

span.span: A collection of objects that describe how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请注意，如果你有多个对象，并且基础源是`DataTable`或`DataView`，视图对象不排序或筛选独立。Note that if you have multiple objects and the underlying source is a `DataTable` or a `DataView`, the view objects do not sort or filter independently. 例如，如果你有两个对象具有相同关联`DataTable`并执行排序视图之一，在其他视图中的项的顺序可能会受到影响。For example, if you have two objects associated with the same `DataTable` and you perform sorting on one of the views, the order of items in the other view can be affected. 这是因为对象使用基础用于排序和筛选功能。This is because objects use the underlying for sorting and filtering functionalities. > [!NOTE] > 此属性只能设置的访问的集合对象，并使用它的各种方法，如`Add`。This property can only be set by accessing the collection object and using its various methods such as `Add`. 要访问集合对象本身的属性是只读的;集合本身是可读/写。The property to access the collection object itself is read-only; the collection itself is read/write.
